text: I think I might be morally obligated to commit suicide I m not a rapist  murderer  pedophile  or anything crazy like that  I m a pretty average person with a lot of issues that often cause me to emotionally depend on and hurt other people  I do have BPD I know how disdained people like me are and I don t really blame people for it  I ve often been an abuser in my life  I haven t had an easy life  but that s no excuse for the way I am  only an explanation  I m an emotional leech  some might call me a black hole Now  I know BPD can get better with treatment and that s always the response I get when I say I think I should kill myself  It can get BETTER  not disappear  and most relapse into symptoms after finishing therapy  Even then  finishing therapy can take a long time  sometimes years to see improvement   So you re telling me I should continue to live in agony  while causing nothing but pain and worry for others  for possibly years to come EVEN IF I get treatment and treatment works  To me  that sounds like a lot of hoops to jump through to get to the realization that there s essentially no hope Doesn t everyone wish for less bad people in the world  How can you hate bad people and turn around and tell me not to kill myself  I ve never heard an actual good argument against suicide for me and I don t think I ever will  The only feasible other morally ambiguous option would be to isolate myself from others as much as possible  but isolation would make me kill myself Anyway  getting harder and harder to convince myself this isn t the right choice
summary: According to BPD sufferer, suicide is the only morally ambiguous option for her. BPD can get better with treatment. Most people with BPD relapse into symptoms after therapy and it can take a long time to see improvement.
cleaned: accord bad sufferer suicide morally ambiguous option bad well treatment people bad relapse symptom therapy long time improvement

text: Living after AttemptingI never thought I would try and kill myself  let alone know the immense guilt I would feel if it didn t work   I remember having a series of horrible days   including being dumped by a guy I really liked  amp  fighting with some of my closest friends   and just deciding it was my time  I felt like the universe was sending me constant signals that I didn t belong anywhere and things would be better if I was gone  as clich  as that may sound  I didn t write any goodbye letters  maybe subconsciously knowing that writing letters would realize the mistake I was making and how much it would hurt the people I love   I woke up the next day in an absolute daze trying to comprehend what I had done  I had class that morning  and I could barely keep myself from breaking down crying  I felt broken far beyond repair  I didn t leave bed for weeks   This was about   weeks before the world shut down  February   Quarantine gave me ample time to just sit and think about how tf I could continue living knowing this was my new reality  that everything I do in my life from this point on is only because I didn t take enough pills  Every time I m hanging out with friends or finishing up a shift at work  I just feel like there is this dark energy looming over me reminding me that I was once willing to abandon this   I don t want to tell anyone  and I haven t  because I don t want them to treat me differently or blame themselves or worry  As a result  I have no choice but to internalize everything and numb myself with marijuana   I m gonna try going to therapy again someday  I hope  I just really don t like the idea of doing therapy over Zoom  Any other survivors out there  What the fuck do I do now
summary: After being dumped by a guy and fighting with some of her closest friends, she tried to kill herself. She didn't leave bed for weeks. She doesn't want to tell anyone because she doesn't like the idea of going to therapy.
cleaned: dump guy fight close friend try kill not leave bed week not want tell not like idea go therapy

text: I dont know how to help my friend  Please help me My friend has never had an really easy life  She never got along with her parents  I remember in elementary school she would always come to school with red eyes  presumably due to crying  Fast forward to when she turned   she had a huge fight with her parents that led to her getting kicked out of her home  She bounced around with friends before renting a place for a while  It was around this time that she starting hanging out with her girlfriend heavily  like to the point where she lived with her  All seemed to be fine until they broke up  My friend  she never  really got over her and it has plagued her since  When everyone went off to college  she happened to end up living only a few rooms down from my friend  She saw her everyday  Saw her with new guys and girls  enjoying life without her and because we all have the same friend group  they saw each other all the time  This along withtrouble adjusting to the college life  led my friend  over the tipping point  She has asked multiple people friends and acquaintances alike to end her life  The first time this happened was last year  its now happened twice  with the last time being   weeks ago  As a result  she has been also getting into harder drugs  mostly heroin  Now she isnt addicted per se but she has done it a handful of times and i dont know how long it takes to get addicted  Basically my question is how do I help my friend  I am way out of my depth  she is a very stubborn and untrusting person and its very hard to get her to like the idea of telling more people because she is worried that people with stop treating her like normal  I feel that if I betray her trust and tell people  she will close off for good and I won t be able to do anything to help Idk if thats too little information or too much  I am just fucking terrified for my friend and I m only a  dumbass   year old  Please help TLDR  Read the whole thing  my friend s life is in danger
summary: My friend's life is in danger. She has asked friends and acquaintances to end her life twice in the last few weeks. She is a stubborn and untrusting person. She doesn't want to tell people because she is afraid they will stop treating her like normal.
